Description: Two joining fragments of lower wall of large East Greek pottery bowl; interior glazed with one added red band lined in white; exterior slipped cream; part of three friezes divided by bands with added red bands lined in white: above, trace of filling ornament; central, two goats to left, heads turned back; rosettes as filling ornament; below, no traces preserved.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AP3
Curator's comments: Probably from same piece as Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA29.

Marked in pencil 'AP3'. This was erroneously attributed to the sanctuary of Salamis-Toumba in Cyprus by Wilson because of similar markings used by the excavators in 1890 (1980, 62 and fig. 9). Bibliography: Wilson, V. 1980, 'The Tubbs-Munro excavations at Salamis 1890', in M. Yon (ed.), Salamine de Chypre. Histoire et archéologique (Paris).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG1068)
